newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville offers only off-peak power for Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville offers only off-peak power for Tuesday.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) continued to offer only off-peak power for Tuesday pre-schedulings, the agency said Friday.
BPA offered non-firm power during hours ending 0600 and 2300 PT on Tuesday at $10.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), and at $9.00 for hours ending 0100-0500 and 2400 PT.
The agency also continued to offer off-peak firm power at $9.00 on Tuesday, as well as Sunday and Monday.
The agency will pre-schedule sales through Tuesday due to the Memorial Day holiday weekend.
BPA also offered non-firm power during peak demand hours ending 0800-2200 on Monday at $15.00 for Northwest sales and $16.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) deals.
Up to 300 MW of firm power was offered during peak demand hours on Monday at $14.50 (Northwest) and $15.50 (COB).
